Icons act as visual aids to help devs complete tasks. They’re simple, informative, and build on the visual language of the design system.

When to use Icons

Icons are powerful visual helpers and should be used with care. Overuse quickly results in user interfaces that are visually overwhelming or distracting.

item.description: All that needs to be said. There is nothing simpler than a circle, except perhaps a straight line, but the circle contains a universe of…
item.content:encoded:
All that needs to be said.

There is nothing simpler than a circle, except perhaps a straight line, but the circle contains a universe of meaning. As being a part of the brand’s name, the filled circle works as ”The period“, which is perhaps the easiest punctuation mark to master. It ends a sentence.

Base Logo

Logo on any background.

Avoid the Period in brand primary color on colorful backgrounds. Use white color for the Period and black for the brand name.

item.content:encoded:
Talk and type strong yet easy and clear

Fiskaly provides a constrained, purposeful set of typographic styles.

Brand Font

DM Sans is our primary headline typeface. It has been selected for its approachability, geometry, and its clean modern look. It’s used for titles, headlines, subheads, and short introductions. Therefore only use font-weight Medium or Bold. DM Sans has quirks that give it a lot of warmth and friendly feel. As a geometric font it presents a clean, simple design, representing purity and balance.

Get DM Sans

Accent Font

Pairing the geometric font with the monospace DM Mono gives Fiskaly the necessary appeal of developer domain.

Get DM Mono

Body Copy

We use a font stack that adapts to the operating system it runs on, like macOS, iOS, Windows, Android or Linux distributions, to make sure all browsers can load platform-specific fonts.

  • Apple devices will display San Francisco
  • Android devices will display Roboto
  • Devices running Windows will display Segoe UI
  • Machines running Linux will display the default sans-serif font for any running distribution
-apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, San Francisco, Segoe UI, Roboto, Helvetica Neue, sans-serif

Encourage calmness, serenity, and strength

The color palette reinforces a dynamic, trusted, and engaging appeal for communications.

Brand Primary

The color “Teal” encourages objective, analytical and deep thinking. It is unconventional, modern, and yet unique in its own way. It also represents cleanliness as well as elegance. The calm shade has a natural dignity that is not contrived. Thanks to the combination of blue and green, teal provides a tranquil effect. Brighter teal tones are unique and smart.

Backgrounds

Consider different background color values for Light and Dark mode.

Text

Consider different color values for Light and Dark mode.

Accents

Attention: Consider the contrast ratio of text on accent backgrounds in switch to dark mode!

item.title: Principles
item.description: Less is more. Systems work best if they are kept simple rather than made complicated. Therefore, simplicity should be a key goal in design…
item.content:encoded:
Less is more.

Systems work best if they are kept simple rather than made complicated. Therefore, simplicity should be a key goal in design, and unnecessary complexity should be avoided.

Voice guidelines

As Fiskaly’s voice, we should always:

  • Be straightforward and easy to understand
  • Be real, but not too pushy or overly familiar
  • Be formal, but not to sassy or insensitive
  • Be confident, but not needy

Actionable language

Developers use Fiskaly to get things done. Content should be written and structured to help them understand and take the most important actions.
